meanings.definition: The ultimate reality underlying all phenomena in Hindu philosophy.
meanings.sent1: In Hindu philosophy, Brahma is believed to be the source of everything.
meanings.sent2: Many people study the concept of Brahma in Hindu philosophy.
meanings.sent3: The idea of Brahma as the ultimate reality can be mind-boggling.
meanings.sent4: To truly understand the universe, one must delve into the concept of Brahma.
meanings.sent5: The concept of Brahma is like a deep ocean of knowledge waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: A member of the highest Hindu caste, that of the priesthood.
meanings.sent1: The Brahma in the village temple leads the prayers every morning.
meanings.sent2: In some Hindu communities, only a Brahma can perform certain rituals.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to be a Brahma and blessed everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The Brahma of the family guided them through difficult times like a beacon of hope.
meanings.sent5: Being a Brahma is not just a title, but a responsibility to uphold traditions.

meanings.sent1: The Brahma chicken is known for its large size and gentle nature.
meanings.sent2: Farmers raise Brahma chickens for their meat and eggs.
meanings.sent3: The Brahma chicken strutted around the coop like a proud king.
meanings.sent4: The Brahma chicken stood out among the other breeds with its majestic appearance.
meanings.sent5: Children love to watch the Brahma chicken pecking around the yard.
